data.title: Rumors Swirl Around ‘Bennifer’: A Complete Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck Timeline—As Both Celebs Are Spotted Alone
data.meta_description: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck met on the set of crime comedy "Gigli” in 2002, and have been linked together on and off ever since.
data.text:
BETA

This is a BETA experience. You may opt-out by clicking here

Rumors Swirl Around ‘Bennifer’: A Complete Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck Timeline—As Both Celebs Are Spotted Alone

May 28, 2024,12:49pm EDT

Topline

After 22 years, five marriages and five children with other partners between them, Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck have made a number of recent appearances apart, fueling speculation about the state of their two-year marriage.

Timeline

Affleck was photographed arriving alone to his daughter Violet's high school graduation in Los Angeles.

Lopez posted a video to social media visiting a new Hollywood billboard put up by Netflix to promote the film “Atlas” reading "Don't F With JLo," which fans were quick to speculate could have a double meaning as she and Affleck stay mum on divorce rumors; the same day, Affleck was spotted alone in Los Angeles.

Lopez was asked on Wednesday if the "rumors" about her and Affleck are true while at a panel to promote her latest film “Atlas,” a video posted to Instagram showed—she shut down the question with a quick, “you know better than that” to the person who asked (whether it was a reporter or audience member was unclear).

Lopez attended the Mexico City premiere of “Atlas” solo on Tuesday while wearing a bridal white gown and simple wedding band (Affleck was reportedly absent due to filming schedules on his own upcoming movie, “The Accountant 2”).

Lopez and Affleck were seen together for the first time in six weeks outside of a school performance for one of Affleck's children, in photos published by several tabloids.

Jennifer Lopez is seen looking at houses in Los Angeles without Affleck, TMZ reported.

Lopez and Affleck are last seen in public together on Easter Sunday on a lunch date at Cecconi’s in Brooklyn.

Lopez releases the album and documentary "This Is Me... Now" with at least two tracks written specifically for her husband: "Dear Ben" (from 2002's "This Is Me...Then" album) and "Dear Ben Pt. II."

Lopez announces the couple, and their children, moved in together.

The pair marries in a Las Vegas ceremony and in August has a party to celebrate at Affleck's Georgia estate.

The couple announces their engagement and Lopez shows off photos of a 8.5 carat natural green diamond ring.

The pair makes their red carpet re-debut at the 2021 Venice Film Festival and follow it up with a Met Gala appearance.

Rumors that Affleck and Lopez are back together are reported by Us Weekly and later confirmed by E! News and People.

Affleck speaks to "InStyle" for the magazine's cover story about Lopez, calling her "the hardest-working person I’ve come across in this business."

Lopez and Rodriguez officially split one month after calling off their engagement.

Affleck and de Armas break up.

Affleck and his "Deep Water" co-star Ana de Armas are spotted kissing in Costa Rica.

Affleck and Shookus break up.

Jennifer Lopez announces she and Rodriguez are engaged.

Affleck begins dating "Saturday Night Live” producer Lindsay Shookus.

Lopez starts dating former Yankees player Alex Rodriguez.

Lopez tells People there was "genuine love" in their then decade-old relationship and says tabloid attention put "a lot of pressure" on the pair.

Garner and Affleck, who have three children, announce their divorce days after their 10th wedding anniversary.

Lopez and Anthony finalize their divorce.

Anthony and Lopez, who had two children together, announce their separation

Affleck marries actress Jennifer Garner, who he met on the set of “Pearl Harbor” four years earlier and started dating in the summer of 2004.

Lopez marries singer Marc Anthony, who she first met in 1998.

Lopez and Affleck officially called it quits.

The couple postpone their wedding one day before the planned ceremony, citing "excessive media attention."

Affleck proposes to Lopez on a trip to Boston to visit his family and the proposal leads Lopez to cry “incredible purging tears of happiness,” she says at the time (the 6.1-carat pink diamond Harry Winston ring is reported to have cost $2.5 million).

Affleck has a steamy cameo in Lopez's “Jenny from the Block” music video, which he later says he regretted: "It not only makes me look like a petulant fool, but it surely qualifies as ungentlemanly."

Lopez is spotted kissing Affleck at her 32nd birthday party and files for divorce from Judd two days later.

Lopez and Affleck meet on the set of crime comedy "Gigli" (Lopez is married to Cris Judd at the time).

Forbes Valuation

Affleck, 51, was ranked at No. 37 on Forbes' list of highest-paid celebrities in 2020, making $55 million that year. He's starred in box office hits like "Batman v. Superman," "Pearl Harbor" and "Armageddon" over his decades-long career, and scored eight-figure salaries for recent films like "The Last Duel" and "Hypnotic." Lopez, 54, was ranked at No. 56 on the highest-paid celebrities list that same year. It's estimated she made $47.5 million thanks to deals with Versace, DSW, Quay sunglasses and her own fragrance. She's built her fortune through eight studio albums, a Las Vegas residency and a series of world tours, including a 2019 world tour that grossed $55 million.
